company.name: ExpatEdge Partners, LLC
company.address: 750 Boone Avenue North, Suite 102, Minneapolis, Minnesota 55427
company.business_description: ExpatEdge provides software and consulting services to businesses that offer expatriate programs to manage tax and payroll issues for employees that work outside their country of residence.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: ExpatEdge Partners, LLC, a Minnesota company providing software and consulting services for expatriate programs, participated in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework by self-certifying to the U.S. Department of Commerce in November 2002 and renewing annually through 2005. In November 2006, the company failed to renew its self-certification, causing Commerce to update its status to 'not current.' Despite losing its active Safe Harbor status, ExpatEdge continued to display statements on its website claiming it self-certified to the Safe Harbor Privacy Program from at least December 2002 through July 2009. The FTC alleged that these ongoing representations falsely implied current participation in the Safe Harbor framework in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act.

representations_made.description: Claimed to self-certify its privacy policy to the U.S. Department of Commerce's Safe Harbor Privacy Program, implying current and active participation in the Safe Harbor framework
representations_made.quoted_text: ExpatEdge self-certifies the Policy to the U.S. Department of Commerce’s Safe Harbor Privacy Program.

counts.title: False Safe Harbor Participation Claim
counts.representation: From at least December 2002 until July 2009, respondent represented, expressly or by implication, that it is a current participant in the Safe Harbor by stating on its website that it self-certifies its policy to the U.S. Department of Commerce's Safe Harbor Privacy Program.
counts.fact: Since November 2006, respondent has not been a current participant in the Safe Harbor, as it failed to renew its self-certification and Commerce updated its status to 'not current.'
counts.conclusion: The representations set forth in Paragraph 11 were, and are, false or misleading, constituting unfair or deceptive acts or practices in or affecting commerce in violation of Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act.

definitions.respondent: ExpatEdge Partners, LLC and its subsidiaries, divisions, affiliates, successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Program Membership or Participation
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, the extent to which it is a member of, certified by, endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy, security, or other compliance program sponsored by government or any third party.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent membership in, adherence to, certification by, endorsement by, or participation in any privacy, security, or other compliance program sponsored by the government or any third party
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, directly or through any corporation, subsidiary, division, website, or other device, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy, security, or any other compliance program sponsored by the government or any other third party.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC, for five years, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including advertisements and any documents calling into question compliance.

requirements.description: Maintain and make available to the FTC for inspection and copying all advertisements, promotional materials, and other statements containing representations covered by the order, with materials relied upon in disseminating those representations, for five years from preparation or dissemination
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall maintain and upon request make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to: A. all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation; and

requirements.description: Maintain and make available to the FTC for inspection and copying any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent's compliance with the order, for five years from preparation or dissemination
requirements.quoted_text: B. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent’s compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Distribution and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.

requirements.description: Deliver a copy of this order to all current principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of the order, and obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt from each, within 30 days after service of the order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order, and shall secure from each such person a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of the order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities.

requirements.description: Deliver a copy of this order to all future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of the order, and obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt from each, within 30 days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: receipt of the order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under this order, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy filing, or change of name or address.

requirements.description: Notify the Commission at least 30 days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, emergence of a successor, creation or dissolution of a subsidiary/parent/affiliate, proposed bankruptcy filing, or change in corporate name or address
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address. Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

requirements.description: If respondent learns of a proposed change fewer than 30 days before it occurs, notify the Commission as soon as practicable after obtaining such knowledge
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

requirements.description: Send all notices required by this Part by certified mail to the Associate Director, Division of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, Washington, D.C. 20580
requirements.quoted_text: All notices required by this Part shall be sent by certified mail to the Associate Director, Division of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, Washington, D.C. 20580.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the FTC within 60 days of service of the order and at such other times as the Commission may require.

requirements.description: File a written report with the Commission within 60 days after service of this order, and at such other times as the Commission may require, setting forth in detail the manner and form in which respondent has complied with this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall, within sixty (60) days after service of this order, and at such other times as the Commission may require, file with the Commission a report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form in which it has complied with this order.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order terminates on November 9, 2029, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging any violation of the order in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.

requirements.description: Order terminates on November 9, 2029, or twenty years from the most recent date a federal court complaint alleging any violation of the order is filed, whichever is later, with exceptions for parts terminating sooner, respondents not named in such complaint, and complaints filed after order termination
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on November 9, 2029, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Part in this order that terminates in fewer than twenty (20) years; B. this order’s application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and Page 3 of 4 C. this order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Part. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that respondent did not violate any provision of the order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the order as to such respondent will terminate according to this Part as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.
requirements.deadline: November 9, 2029 or 20 years from last complaint, whichever is later

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on November 9, 2029, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Part in this order that terminates in fewer than twenty (20) years; B. this order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Part.
